instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not post
threads.message: Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in dead. Corrosion only around JTAG, so removed JTAG to get the fan to spin, but now it does not post (no light on the mouse). CPU vcore is 1.5v. The fan also immediately spins up, not on and off a few times first. It is also spinning at max RPM.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not post
threads.message: Continuity test on all lines and resistors from bios chip....
